title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: R. M. Manly to Crammond Kennedy, October 9, 1867
summary: Manly writes Kennedy that he has decided to send Mary Rowell to Staunton to serve as a teacher, since the teachers who were in Staunton the previous year have not returned. He also refers to Thomas Jackson as one of the Bureau's best agents.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Education, Women, American Civil War
